title: Have you ever said something that got you in trouble immediately afterwards but was totally worth it looking back? - Quora

response.answer_text: I was the recipient of "bully mobbing" at work- to the point that I was put before a "tribunal" of my so-called peers. After they'd had their say, they expected me to sign a document agreeing to their list of grievances. I looked down at the document, said "this meeting is over, I'm not signing anything" walked out and packed up my things. to put it in perspective, many of my good colleagues were stunned, and helped me out to my car.

Standing up for same sex marriage when in a speech within my public speaking class. Be it the students may have scoffed and snided in reaction, hopefully it at least brought them a sense of awareness of a perspective and life that is outside their own that also has a right to be considered and respected.

I told the assistant manager's boyfriend to F*** OFF. I explained why and she was okay with it but obviously not thrilled. In retrospect, he absolutely deserved it for disrespecting me and was standing up for myself.
